variant.question: The data stored in the performance database of an FMS is mainly used..

options.text: to calculate engine thrust settings.
for LNAV calculations
to validate GNSS position and satellite data.
to calculate IRS positions.

variant.question: Which of the following statements regarding the "performance factor" is correct? It is aâ€¦

options.text: positive or negative factor that is used to correct the predicted fuel flow.
positive or negative factor that is used to calculate the percentage error in fuel consumption due to differences between nominal and icing conditions.
positive factor that is used to show the percentage increase in fuel consumption when there is an abnormal increase in drag.
cost index used to show the efficiency of the aircraft as a percentage of the nominal performance.

variant.question: During FMS initialization, the crew must verify that the aircraft performance database correct, based on the aeroplane and engine configuration. This is because the FMS uses the data to...

options.text: calculate an optimum vertical profile.
determine which mass and balance requirements apply.
determine the Regulated Take-Off Mass restrictions.
calculate an optimum lateral profile.

variant.question: During the cockpit preparation phase, the flight crew notices that the Performance Database is incorrect on the FMS, being for a different aircraft and engine type. What must they do in this case?

options.text: The mechanics must change the database.
Manually select the correct database.
Proceed with the flight but notify the maintenance crew.
Nothing, this is not an issue.

variant.question: The factor(s) which are considered by the FMS for Cost Index (CI) is/are:

options.text: Landing gear stuck down.
One engine inoperative.
Air brakes stuck partially deployed.
One engine inoperative and flaps stuck partially deployed.

variant.question: Which Flight Management System databases are typically loadable?

options.text: The navigation database and the operating system.
The performance database and the user database.
The navigation database and the performance database.
The navigation database and the user database.

variant.question: Concerning the FMS, entering a high cost index results in:

options.text: minimum trip fuel.
minimum airspeed.
maximum range airspeed.
high airspeed and high fuel consumption.

variant.question: The purpose of the performance database in the FMC is:

options.text: To let the FMC know the optimum performance data for the aircraft in question.
To tell the FMC the required performance to be able to fly a certain route.
To record the performance of the aircraft over time and to adapt the flight routes accordingly.
To keep track of the performance of the flight crew.

variant.question: During the pre-flight checks, you notice that the performance database is for the wrong aircraft type. What should you do?

options.text: Fly the aircraft.
Update the database manually.
Fly the flight but report it to maintenance on completion for rectification.
Report to maintenance as this is a maintenance task to fix this fault.

variant.question: Is it possible for the flight crew to change data in the performance database?

options.text: No, it can only be done by maintenance.
Yes, it can only change engine thrust rating.
Yes, it can only change the fuel consumption.
No, because thereâ€™s no indication in the aircraft about the performance database the can be accessed by the flight crew.

variant.question: What does the pilot need to do regarding the performance database in the FMC before taking off?

options.text: Enter the correct number index of load sheet.
Download to maintenance staff and erase it.
Nothing needs to be done by the pilot.
Check that it is up to date.

variant.question: The purpose of a performance database is:

options.text: To adjust the route depending on the performance of the aircraft.
To track the performance of the aircraft over time and make adjustments due to age and wear.
To monitor the performance of the crew.
To provide information for the FMS regarding the performance characteristics of a given aircraft.
